content.welcomeHeader: Welcome To the wonders of SRILANKA
content.welcomeParagraph: Sri Lanka's wildlife is as varied as the island itself...

sections.title: Tropical Rainforests and fauna
sections.description: Sri Lanka's 2.14% lowland rainforests, exemplified by the UNESCO Sinharaja Forest Reserve...

sections.title: Dry zone
sections.description: The Dry Zone in Sri Lanka, housing the Sri Lanka dry-zone dry evergreen forests...

sections.title: Tropical Lower Montane Forest
sections.description: Sri Lanka's Tropical Lower Montane Forests, situated above 1,000 m in the Central Highlands and Knuckles mountains...

wildlifeSection.title: Wild Life In Sri Lanka
wildlifeSection.information: Sri Lanka is a wildlife haven, boasting a rich array of flora and fauna...
hotspots: Yala National Park: for its population of leopards...
Sinharaja Forest Reserve: UNESCO World Heritage Site is a biodiversity hotspot...
Udawalawe National Park: for its large population of wild elephants...
uniqueExperiences: The Gathering of Elephants: Witness the largest seasonally recurring concentration of wild elephants...
Blue and Sperm Whales: Lanka offers exceptional opportunities for whale watching...
conservationAndBiodiversity: Sri Lanka boasts a high rate of biological endemism...
The country's montane and sub-montane wet forests, such as the Sri Lanka Montane Rainforests, are home to a wealth of endemic species...
